channel.title: Need a Command/method

item.title: Need a Command/method
item.dc:creator: @Owner_A_Raffo Owner A Raffo
item.description:
@Owner_A_Raffo wrote:

[code]else if (command.startsWith(“sexy”) && playerRights >= 1)
{
try {
String Sexy = command.substring(4);
int SexyID = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Gay);
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[SexyID];
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = " Are you sexy??? “+Sexy; {
p.setAnimation(855);
txt4=Sexy+” are you sexy??";
string4UpdateRequired = true;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = Sexy+"-Yes, i am a sexy!";
sendMessage(“You have successfully embarrassed “+Sexy+”.”);

        }  }catch(Exception e) {
                    sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use as ::sexy [PLAYERNAME].");
                 }
              }[/code]

and this and figure it out from here.

item.title: Need a Command/method
item.dc:creator: @Pk_all_Noobz Pk all Noobz
item.description:
@Pk_all_Noobz wrote:

Need a method so I can make others say stuff…

I have this so far… I just need a method… Mine isn’t working

[code]

public String[] getSplits(String command){
String[] ans = new String[2];
ans[0] = command.substring(command.indexOf(" “),command.indexOf(”,"));
ans[1] = command.substring(command.indexOf(",")+1,command.length());
return ans;
}

if (command.startsWith(“control”) && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Killa”)) {
String[] args = getSplits(command);
String name = (args[0]);
String s = (args[1]);
try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); // from this part on it fails… It knows that player name is the 1st word and the s is the string that needs to be said but it doesnt say it
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
c.plrText = s;
c.plrTextUpdateRequired = true;
c.updateRequired = true;
}catch(Exception e) {
sM(name+" either isn’t online or doesn’t exist");
}
}[/code]
